rows.title: I certify that this claim is for Lynna Allen and that I personally gave birth to a child, resulting in this disability claim.

validationData.validationText: Delivery date can't be in the future. Please file a claim after you have delivered.

text: We cannot process your pregnancy claim until after you deliver. If you stopped working due to a complication of pregnancy, you may file a Disability Claim.
Please verify the delivery date. We cannot find an active policy for that date. If you feel this is in error, please call 800-622-1113.

sections.header: Did you stop working before delivery due to complications of pregnancy?
Were there complications that will extend your recovery more than 6 weeks beyond your delivery date?
Were there complications that will extend your recovery more than 8 weeks beyond your delivery date?
Did you or do you plan to return to work before 7/1/2022?

validationData.validationText: Return to work date must be after  and before 7/1/2022
Return to work date must be after  and before 7/1/2022

rows.title: Diagnosis Date
rows.helpText: The date you first received confirmation of your pregnancy from a physician. This does not include home pregnancy tests.

validationData.validationText: Diagnosis date can't be in the future

text: You've been sent to the disability claim form for pregnancy.

sections.header: Documents Needed to File Your Claim

text: Your employer and physician need to complete their statements in order for your claim to be processed.
If we have to request additional information from a medical provider you will also need to complete an Authorization to Disclose Information Form.
You've been sent to the disability claim form for pregnancy.

sections.header: Documents Needed to File Your Claim

text: Your employer and physician need to complete their statements in order for your claim to be processed.
If we have to request additional information from a medical provider you will also need to complete an Authorization to Disclose Information Form.

sections.header: Documents Needed to File Your Claim

text: Your employer and physician need to complete their statements in order for your claim to be processed.
If we have to request additional information from a medical provider you will also need to complete an Authorization to Disclose Information Form.
The medical professional that was your primary care giver during pregnancy. ex: OBGYN, midwife

validationData.validationText: Invalid phone. Phone number must be 10 digits.
Admission date cannot be in the future.
Please verify the hospital admission date. We cannot find an active policy for that date. If you feel this is in error, please call 800-622-1113.
Discharge date must come after admit date.
Discharge date cannot be in the future

text: The date of delivery does not fall within the hospital admission and discharge dates

sections.footer: Please provide the following information so that your benefit, if one is due, may be calculated.

rows.title: Your Annual Salary
rows.helpText: Provide your annual salary. Do not include spouse or household income.

text: In order for us to accurately process your claim, we will need one of the following two items: recent paystub or employer claim form.

rows.title: 2. Employer Claim Form
text: Employer Claim Form is being provided separately.
Your Disability Policy pays a per day benefit. In order for us to accurately process your claim, we will need the following two items: your school calendar and employer claim form.

rows.title: 1. Your School Calendar
text: School Calendar is being provided separately.

rows.title: 2. Employer Claim Form
text: Employer Claim Form is being provided separately.

sections.footer: NOTE: Per Federal Law, FICA (ex. Medicare and Social Security) taxes may be withheld from your benefit. This is different than Federal Income Taxes.

text: Your benefit may be subject to Federal Income Tax. If you choose to not withhold, your income taxes may be affected at tax time. Choose your withholdings preference below.

validationData.validationText: Amount must be $88 or more a month.

sections.helpText: I authorize American Fidelity Assurance Company (AF) to initiate deposits to my account. I also authorize AF to debit my account for any deposits made in error. This authorization remains effective and in full force until AF receives notification from me of its termination in such time and manner to give AF and the Depository a reasonable opportunity to act on it.

By checking this box, youre agreeing to receive your EOBs electronically. However, for claims that do not result in a payment, you will still receive a mailed copy of your EOBs. To view your EOBs, visit the My Benefits section and select View Claims.

text: You have required documents to provide before filing your claim.

If you have those now, or if they have already been provided, click the "Back" button and update your claim.

Or, Save this claim for later, and come back to upload when you have them.

fraudLanguage.esig: I acknowledge that I have read and understand the fraud information provided above and wish to continue with the electronic claim filing process. I understand that I must complete the process in order for my claim to be filed. To the best of my knowledge and belief, all of the information I have provided or that I provide during this electronic claim filing process is true and correct.
fraudLanguage.esigEob: I understand that if I have direct deposit, my explanation of benefits (EoBs) will not be mailed to me. I am able to check claim status and view EoBs on this website.
fraudLanguage.esigProvider: I authorize the Provider(s) listed on my claim form to validate the information I have provided.
